definition: (literary) fatigued/wearied
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal
travel-worn
travel-worn

sentences.english: Blame was attached upon Prime Minister Laughton's Cabinet for yielding to the Russians.
sentences.chinese: 勞頓首相的內閣因向俄國人屈服而受到責難。

sentences.english: Mr Broughton, your reaction to the outcome today?
sentences.chinese: 布勞頓先生，對今天的結果你的迴應是怎樣呢？

sentences.english: Only time will tell whether Broughton's optimism is justified.
sentences.chinese: 只有時間會驗證布勞頓的樂觀是否合理。

sentences.english: Liverpool FC's chairman Martin Broughton and managing director Christian Purslow were also in the High Court.
sentences.chinese: 俱樂部主席布勞頓和總經理帕斯洛同樣在高法出面。

sentences.english: Lawton was an amateur singer until the age of 40, when he turned professional.
sentences.chinese: 勞頓本是個業餘歌手，直到40歲才成爲專業歌手。

sentences.english: He returned from the trip and he must be very tired.
sentences.chinese: 他旅遊回來了，一定是舟車勞頓。

sentences.english: The various recreational facilities for cruise you turn travel Lawton.
sentences.chinese: 郵輪上的各種娛樂設施爲您撫平旅途勞頓。

sentences.english: Hope you are not so tired after such a tougher journey!
sentences.chinese: 今天很失敗，敗在“舟車勞頓，一路辛苦”。

sentences.english: Broughton took a sickie on Monday to paint his fence.
sentences.chinese: 布勞頓星期一稱病請了一天假來粉刷柵欄。

sentences.english: I want to pay tribute to Martin Broughton and the magnificent job he has done for Liverpool FC.
sentences.chinese: 我要向布勞頓和他在利物浦出色的工作成果致敬。

sentences.english: Instead he traveled to Broughton or Harvey River ecclesias to support them.
sentences.chinese: 他旅行到布勞頓哈維河教會去支持他們。

sentences.english: Come, there has never been such a frequent journey Laughton.
sentences.chinese: 來，也從來沒有過這樣的頻頻旅途勞頓。

sentences.english: At the end of the journey they looked quite worn out.
sentences.chinese: 經過旅途勞頓，他們顯得疲憊不堪。

sentences.english: The workers were occupied in building new houses.
sentences.chinese: 工人們正在勞頓着蓋新房子。

sentences.english: We feel a reduction in the amount of time Darren spends travelling will help him achieve this.
sentences.chinese: 我們覺得弗萊徹少點旅途勞頓的話會更有利於恢復。

sentences.english: Almost the whole flower of the Scottish Highlands fell at Culloden.
sentences.chinese: 蘇格蘭高地的優秀分子幾乎全部都犧牲在克勞頓。

definition: bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom
lit. heart untroubled, spirit pleased (idiom); carefree and relaxed
to eat and eat/to stuff oneself
to drink hard

(last line of the poem 望岳 by Tang poet Du Fu 杜甫[Du4 Fu3]) with one look I shall see all the smaller mountains down below (from the summit of Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1])/(fig.) awe-inspiring view from a very high place
nuée ardente/hot cloud of volcanic ash
dull/insipid
leisurely and comfortable/relaxed
the still of the night (idiom)/late at night
feast/celebration
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
the way back/one's journey home
variant of 流連|流连[liu2 lian2]
to walk alone (idiom)
to stand tall and see far (idiom); taking the long and broad view/acute foresight
variant of 悠閒|悠闲/leisurely
